Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY 10007

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER FREED
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R. C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY 10007

Council Member FREED moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections

REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES, PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS

Approving the Reappointment by the Mayor of DAVID S. LANDE as a member of the Civil Service Commission of New York City

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on October 27, 1999, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 813 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the reappointment of DAVID S. LANDE, (a Republican from Manhattan), as a Member of the Civil Service Commission for the remainder of a six year term, which commenced on March 22, 1999 and expires on March 21, 2005.

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT OF DAVID S. LANDE AS A MEMBER OF THE CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION OF NEW YORK CITY

By Council Member Povman:

	RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 813 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment of DAVID S. LANDE, (a Republican from Manhattan), as a Member of the Civil Service Commission of New York City.  Mr. Lande's reappointment will be for the remainder of a six year term which commenced on March 22, 1999 and will expire on March 21, 2005.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reappointment of David S. Lande to the Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Membership Changes to Certain Standing Committees
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Membership Changes to Certain Standing Committees

Items.Title:
Membership Changes to Certain Standing Committees
The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Election respectfully

REPORTS

That it recommends favorable consideration by the Council of the following membership changes, to the following standing committees pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York.

EDUCATION: (Dilan) MOSKOWITZ
CONTRACTS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ
	
GOVERNMENTAL OPERATIONS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ	
PARKS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ

RESOLUTION
Resolution approving Membership Changes to Certain Standing Committees

By Council Member Povman:

Resolved, That pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York, the Council does hereby consent to the following membership changes, to the following standing committees:

EDUCATION: (Dilan) MOSKOWITZ
CONTRACTS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ
	
GOVERNMENTAL OPERATIONS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ	
PARKS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Membership Changes to Certain Standing Committees

Membership Changes to Certain Standing Committees
The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Election respectfully

REPORTS

That it recommends favorable consideration by the Council of the following membership changes, to the following standing committees pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York.

EDUCATION: (Dilan) MOSKOWITZ
CONTRACTS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ
	
GOVERNMENTAL OPERATIONS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ	
PARKS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ

RESOLUTION
Resolution approving Membership Changes to Certain Standing Committees

By Council Member Povman:

Resolved, That pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York, the Council does hereby consent to the following membership changes, to the following standing committees:

EDUCATION: (Dilan) MOSKOWITZ
CONTRACTS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ
	
GOVERNMENTAL OPERATIONS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ	
PARKS: (Eristoff) MOSKOWITZ

Items.Title:
REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES, PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS

Approving the Reappointment by the Mayor of DAVID S. LANDE as a member of the Civil Service Commission of New York City

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on October 27, 1999, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 813 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the reappointment of DAVID S. LANDE, (a Republican from Manhattan), as a Member of the Civil Service Commission for the remainder of a six year term, which commenced on March 22, 1999 and expires on March 21, 2005.

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE REAPPOINTMENT OF DAVID S. LANDE AS A MEMBER OF THE CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION OF NEW YORK CITY

By Council Member Povman:

	RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 813 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the reappointment of DAVID S. LANDE, (a Republican from Manhattan), as a Member of the Civil Service Commission of New York City.  Mr. Lande's reappointment will be for the remainder of a six year term which commenced on March 22, 1999 and will expire on March 21, 2005.
Items.MatterName: Reappointment of David S. Lande to the Civil Service Commission
